pyramid.plunder

Class SaveLoad

  • java.lang.Object
    • pyramid.plunder.SaveLoad

  • public class SaveLoad
extends java.lang.Object
    In this SaveLoad Class, a BufferedWriter is implemented in a try-catch statement for the user to save his/her game, the specific location and health is saved onto the .dat file in another try-catch statement, the game objects location are saved as well as their specific information, such as health and location.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SaveLoad() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean load(java.lang.String fileName)
      In this load method, the String fileName is passed.
      static boolean playerData(java.lang.String fileName)
      In this boolean playerData the String fileName is passed; the user's data is saved onto a .dat file, which the user can access.
      static void save(boolean inLevel)
      In this save method, a BufferedWriter is implemented in a try-catch statement for the user to save his/her game, the specific location and health is saved onto the .dat file in another try-catch statement, the game objects location are saved as well as their specific information, such as health and location.

      • save

        public static void save(boolean inLevel)
        In this save method, a BufferedWriter is implemented in a try-catch statement for the user to save his/her game, the specific location and health is saved onto the .dat file in another try-catch statement, the game objects location are saved as well as their specific information, such as health and location.
        Parameters:
        inLevel -

      • load

        public static boolean load(java.lang.String fileName)
        In this load method, the String fileName is passed. A try-catch statement is implemented below in order for the user to access his/her saved .dat file.

      • playerData

        public static boolean playerData(java.lang.String fileName)
        In this boolean playerData the String fileName is passed; the user's data is saved onto a .dat file, which the user can access. The try-catch statement is implemented below for this.
